dataIdInfo.idAbs: Thorium forward modelling. This is a port / modification of the original IDL code from ______________.

tool.name: ThoriumModelOnce

param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: The workspace (GDB) where the derived output will be stored.

param.name: outputname
param.dialogReference:
A comma separated list of output names, e.g. 'HA1,HA2,HA3,HA4,...,HA51'.

Note: The number of entries in the list should correspond to the number of abundance fields be processed (below).

param.name: thorium_raster
param.dialogReference: The 0.5 degree per pixel thorium abundance raster.

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: A vector polygon layer containing digitized thorium ROIs. The layer should have one or more abundance fields (naming is not important).

param.name: abundance
param.dialogReference:
Check each column that corresponds to a different realization of the Th abundance. For example, if the shapefile contains three fields (ab1, ab2, and ab3), each containing a different abundance distribution, the model can be run for each separately by only checking a single field, or for all columns, by checking ab1, ab2, and ab3.

Note: The number of checked fields should match the number of provided outputnames to ensure unique outputs.

param.name: fill
param.dialogReference: The fill value applied to the buffer and/or any gaps in the input raster. This is effectively the 'no data value'.

param.name: padmode
param.expression: constant | edge | maximum | mean | reflect | symmetric
param.dialogReference:
The mode used to buffer the region of interest to try and handle edge effects. Constant or edge are likely the most appropriate.

  • Constant - pad using the fill value

  • Edge - Pad using the pixel value at the edge of valid data.

  • Reflect - Extract a vector of length n from the valid data area and reflect it into the buffer, where nis the total buffer size

  • Symmetrical - Extract a vector of length nand shift it into the buffer area, where nis the total buffer size

  • Mean - Fill using the mean value of the row / column

  • Minimum - Fill using the minimum value of the row / column

  • Maximum - Fill using the maximum value of the row / column

param.name: kappa
param.dialogReference: The kappa value required by the model.

param.name: sigma
param.dialogReference: The sigma value used to control the extent of the kappa filter.

param.name: resolution
param.dialogReference: The model is applied at a resolution finer than the 0.5 degree per pixel resolution of the Thorium base. How many 'sub-pixels' should each Thorium pixel be segmented into?

param.name: uncertraster
param.dialogReference: An uncertainty raster used in the generation of the difference map.

tool.summary: Thorium forward modelling. This is a port / modification of the original IDL code from ______________.
